intro: Argostemma parvifolium var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved argostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
